videos.title: Episode 03: introduction to Blueprint in UE5
videos.description:
In this session, we’ll explore Blueprint, Unreal Engine's visual scripting system, perfect for creating interactive game elements without coding.
 
What You’ll Learn
Blueprint Basics

Overview of visual scripting and its role in Unreal Engine.
Key components: Event Graph, Construction Script, and Functions.
Creating Your First Blueprint

Build a simple interactive object, like a door that opens when triggered.
Learn essential nodes like Event BeginPlay, Input Events, and Variables.
Debugging & Optimization

Use the Blueprint Debugger to fix issues and improve performance.
Duration: ~120 minutes
By the end, you’ll confidently create basic mechanics using Blueprints!

videos.title: Episode 04: Gi Light Baking Techniques in UE5
videos.description:
In this session, we’ll focus on Global Illumination (GI) light baking techniques to achieve high-quality, realistic lighting in Unreal Engine.

What You’ll Learn
Introduction to Light Baking

What is GI, and why is baking important?
Dynamic vs. baked lighting: pros and cons.
Preparing Your Scene for Baking

Lightmap resolution: setting the right values.
Optimizing UVs for clean bakes.
Baking Techniques

Configuring Lightmass settings for better results.
Controlling light bounce and indirect intensity.
Using post-process volumes to enhance baked GI.
Debugging and Optimization

Fixing common artifacts like light leaks and splotches.
Reducing bake times without sacrificing quality.
Practical Example:

Bake lighting for a simple interior scene with soft shadows and natural GI effects.

Cinematic Lighting Principles

Lighting Tools in UE5

Using directional, point, and spotlights for dramatic effects.

Creating Atmosphere

Working with fog, volumetric lighting, and light shafts.
Enhancing depth and scale through atmospheric effects.
Color and Tone

Color grading techniques to refine the look.
Balancing warm and cool lighting for emotional impact.
Practical Example:

Set up a cinematic scene with a focus on dramatic storytelling using carefully placed lighting and atmospheric effects.

videos.title: Episode 08: Cinematic lighting techniques part02 in Ue5
videos.description:
In this episode, we'll build on the concepts introduced in Part 01 to refine cinematic lighting techniques, ensuring the scenes convey the desired mood, story, and visual impact in Unreal Engine 5.


---

Key Topics

1. Fine-Tuning Lighting for Storytelling

Adjusting light intensity, temperature, and direction for emotional impact.

Using contrast to highlight key story elements.

Lighting to guide the audience's attention in dynamic scenes.



2. Advanced Volumetric Effects

Using Exponential Height Fog and volumetric fog for atmosphere.

Creating god rays and haze for dramatic visuals.

Combining volumetric lighting with particle effects for added realism.



3. Color Grading and Post-Processing

Enhancing scenes with LUTs (Look-Up Tables).

Controlling exposure, bloom, and lens flare.

Balancing colors for cinematic consistency.

4. Using Light Layers

Separating key lights, fill lights, and background lights for more control.

Creating dynamic lighting layers to adjust on-the-fly during animations.

5. Animating Lights

Adding movement to lights for realism (e.g., flickering, swinging lights).

Simulating natural light changes like sunset, sunrise, or passing clouds.


6. Practical Tips for Rendering

Optimizing lightmaps and reflection captures.

Adjusting Lumen settings for better real-time results.

Baking high-quality lighting for pre-rendered sequences.
